item.title: Gnome Desktop UX Review
item.description: I have been working with Debian GNU/Linux (yes, GNU to acknowledge what Richard Stallman has done and is still doing to free us from proprietary software) as my desktop (or laptop) OS for many years now and I’m very happy with it.

item.title: Shell commands with GNU sed
item.description: sed is useful to replace some text on the fly. But how about processing text on the fly with shell commands instead of just replacing it with fixed content?

item.title: ssh Agent Forwarding
item.description:
Quite often it is necessary to ssh via an intermediate host if the destination host is not directly accessible through ssh. Usually people do this:

ssh user@host1
ssh host2
# you'll have to enter your password

item.title: Finding unicode symbols on the shell
item.description:

item.title: Download and unzip in one command
item.description:
With tar it is possible to do something like this:

wget -O- http://example.com/my.tar.gz | tar xvz
